segment.source: Exclusion Items Tab
segment.target: Exclusion Items Tab

segment.source: Exclusion Items Tab
segment.target: Exclusion Items Tab

segment.source: Exclusion Items Tab
segment.target: Exclusion Items Tab

segment.source: The Exclusion Items tab displays the expressions that the Application Virtualization Sequencer excludes from the virtual file system or virtual registry.
segment.target: The Exclusion Items tab displays the expressions that the Application Virtualization Sequencer excludes from the virtual file system or virtual registry.

segment.source: These expressions are excluded to ensure that the sequenced application package can run on Application Virtualization Desktop Clients.
segment.target: These expressions are excluded to ensure that the sequenced application package can run on Application Virtualization Desktop Clients.

segment.source: You can also exclude non-standard installation directories that might be unwanted in the sequencing.
segment.target: You can also exclude non-standard installation directories that might be unwanted in the sequencing.

segment.source: This tab contains the following elements.
segment.target: This tab contains the following elements.

segment.source: Exclude Path
segment.target: Exclude Path

segment.source: Displays variable names that the Sequencer excludes if encountered while parsing virtual file system items or virtual registry items.
segment.target: Displays variable names that the Sequencer excludes if encountered while parsing virtual file system items or virtual registry items.

segment.source: Resolves To
segment.target: Resolves To

segment.source: Displays the actual paths that correspond to the Sequencer variables.
segment.target: Displays the actual paths that correspond to the Sequencer variables.

segment.source: Map Type
segment.target: Map Type

segment.source: Displays mapping rules that the Sequencer applies to parse items in the virtual file system or virtual registry.
segment.target: Displays mapping rules that the Sequencer applies to parse items in the virtual file system or virtual registry.

segment.source: One of the following values can occur:
segment.target: One of the following values can occur:

segment.source: New
segment.target: New

segment.source: Click to enter a new exclusion item.
segment.target: Click to enter a new exclusion item.

segment.source: Edit
segment.target: Edit

segment.source: Click to edit a selected exclusion.
segment.target: Click to edit a selected exclusion.

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: Click to remove a selected exclusion.
segment.target: Click to remove a selected exclusion.

segment.source: Save As Default
segment.target: Save As Default

segment.source: Click to save the current exclusion items as your default.
segment.target: Click to save the current exclusion items as your default.

segment.source: Restore Defaults
segment.target: Restore Defaults

segment.source: Click to restore default-assigned exclusion items and remove any items you added.
segment.target: Click to restore default-assigned exclusion items and remove any items you added.

segment.source: OK
segment.target: OK

segment.source: Click to accept the displayed exceptions.
segment.target: Click to accept the displayed exceptions.

segment.source: Cancel
segment.target: Cancel

segment.source: Click to cancel any changes you have made.
segment.target: Click to cancel any changes you have made.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics
